ai.summary: Coastal Path is a short, easy 3.9 km hike along the UK coast, offering sea views, gentle gradients, and opportunities to observe wildlife. Ideal for beginners, families, or anyone seeking a relaxed coastal stroll.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat to gently rolling paths along a coastline, with stretches of compacted gravel, pavement, and occasional boardwalks. Expect wet sections near the shore and some rocky patches.
ai.safety_notes: Always check the local tide chart and weather forecast before starting. Stay on marked paths and keep a safe distance from cliff edges and unstable ground. Wear sturdy, non-slip footwear and bring a light waterproof layer. Be prepared for windy conditions and sun exposure; use sunscreen and a hat. Carry water and a small first-aid kit, and have a charged phone with emergency numbers. If walking with children, supervise closely near the water.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation on a phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) are the most pleasant for coastal walking in the UK. Winter visits can be chilly and stormy; always check the forecast and daylight hours if you go then.

seo.title: Coastal Path – Easy 3.9 km Coastal Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Coastal Path, an easy 3.9 km coastal hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, and gear to enjoy a relaxed sea-side stroll.
